Dear Sir Kupert, i .iliile you are considering rriy note No. C/276 of November 21 about the Sheish of Kuwait’s guns I should be glad if you would review the position of A 6 posts in the Gulf. You will remember that on my arrival in Bahrain you asiied me to accept past gulf practice in the matter of salutes and calls because you had not had time to sort the matter out since the hand-over. I said that I fully realised the difficulties about salutes because Sheikhs’ salutes were involved and that the question of guns night well be left for a general overhaul but that I considered the question of calls, particularly where the Navy was concerned, should be settled on the basis of personal ran^. The matter was not pursued because you went away immediately and such calls as I paid on the Navy were in the capacity of Acting Political Resident. The present Senior Naval Officer, Persian Gulf, is clearly anxious that I should maxce first calls on him but it seems to me that he has no leg to stand on being junior to me in rantc, age and length of service. titleInfo.title: 'File 27/4 DESIGNATION, STATUS, SALUTES OF POLITICAL OFFICERS IN THE PERSIAN GULF.'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers in the file are arranged chronologically.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover, and terminates at the inside back cover; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is also present in parallel between ff 2-10; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and can be found in the same position as the main sequence.

mods.abstract: Correspondence discusses the designation, status and salutes of British officials in the Gulf in the context of the transfer of responsibility from the India Office to the Foreign Office.Correspondents include Major Maurice O'Connor Tandy, Political Agent, Kuwait; Major Hugh Dunstan Rance, Political Agent, Bahrain; Captain Joseph Edward Havelock Hudson, Political Agent, Muscat; William Rupert Hay, Political Resident, Persian Gulf; Eion Pelly Donaldson, India Office, London; H G Jakins, Political Agent, Kuwait.
